text: [Music]
I was reading the New York Times book
review one Sunday and there was a review
of a new translation of the anid
Virgil's epic about a man whose mission
is to found Rome he leaves Troy which is
a disaster you know this whole city is
destroyed and then he finds founds Rome
which is is going to be an Empire and
destroy a lot more cities so that's an
interesting like why would you leave
Troy and found Rome it's always been an
interesting question in the middle he
goes to Carthage and he falls in love
with a woman who is a queen and who's
building a new city and there's this
idea of oh a different city that's not
involved in war and destruction an
Empire that's involved in the Arts and
Commerce and a man and woman would rule
rule as equals but no no no no no he has
to leave her to fulfill his mission
that's the old old old Epic from so long
ago it should be out of date but it's of
course not anyway I was reading this
book review which was praising this new
translation by Fitzgerald it is
exquisite and it's zeroed in on the
place where anise goes to the underworld
to look for his father and he meets da
who uh he's startled to see to realized
that after he abruptly left her to
fulfill his mission she had killed
herself and he says to her I couldn't
believe I would hurt you so terribly by
going and I remember sitting there it
was Sunday morning and I thought how
could a sensitive intelligent man not
know the effects of his action on
someone who he really loved you know he
was deeply involved with and then I
thought how crazy for a woman in that
situation where you feel somebody's
deeply connected with you and loves you
and acts as if there was no connection
and I thought Virgil was however many
hundred years
ago I thought but this is very
contemporary this story goes on and on
so out of that came the characters Kira
and Andreas she's an architect building
a city he's carrying the household Gods
he's carrying from Europe of the 20th
century and he's directing operas he's a
musician and a theater director so they
meet and they've each had huge losses
that are part of that history of that's
still going on of people who you know
whose lives have been Shattered by
political conflict and War this goes on
all the time so they're not planning to
fall in love and the two of them fall in
love with each other because you can
just see these two are going to be
obviously attracted to each other so
that's how the novel starts and then
because I'm writing in about a
contemporary woman I mean she doesn't
commit suicide like Virgil's
Dao I but what happens when he leaves
her is she does feel what's happened to
her sense of reality so she goes into
she's a modern woman she goes into
therapy so the whole second part of the
novel they new characters Greta the
therapist comes in and Roya her friend
who's an architect
anyway I was not planning to write a
novel and out of that came this novel
Kira which was amazing to write cuz it
took me into just incredible worlds
including the world of architecture
